translations.chinese: 陳胡公滿者，虞帝舜之後也。
translations.literal: Chen Hu Gong Man was Yu Emperor Shun's descendant.
translations.idiomatic: Chen's Duke Hu Man was a descendant of Emperor Shun of Yu.

context.next: 昔舜為庶人時，堯妻之二女，居于媯汭，其後因為氏姓，姓媯氏。

translations.chinese: 昔舜為庶人時，堯妻之二女，居于媯汭，其後因為氏姓，姓媯氏。
translations.literal: Formerly when Shun was a commoner, Yao married him two daughters, and they resided at Gui Rui. Their descendants therefore became the clan surname, the Gui clan.
translations.idiomatic: In ancient times, when Shun was still a commoner, Emperor Yao married his two daughters to him, and they lived at the bend of the Gui River. Their descendants thus became a clan and took the surname Gui.

context.previous: 陳胡公滿者，虞帝舜之後也。
context.next: 舜已崩，傳禹天下，而舜子商均為封國。

translations.chinese: 舜已崩，傳禹天下，而舜子商均為封國。
translations.literal: Shun had already passed away and transmitted the world to Yu, while Shun's son Shang Jun was made an enfeoffed state.
translations.idiomatic: After Shun passed away and transferred rulership of the world to Yu, Shun's son Shang Jun was still granted a fief as a vassal state.

context.previous: 昔舜為庶人時，堯妻之二女，居于媯汭，其後因為氏姓，姓媯氏。
context.next: 夏后之時，或失或續。

translations.chinese: 夏后之時，或失或續。
translations.literal: During the Xia Hou time, some were lost and some continued.
translations.idiomatic: During the Xia dynasty, some of these hereditary lines were lost while others continued.

context.previous: 舜已崩，傳禹天下，而舜子商均為封國。
context.next: 至于周武王克殷紂，乃復求舜後，得媯滿，封之於陳，以奉帝舜祀，是為胡公。

translations.chinese: 至于周武王克殷紂，乃復求舜後，得媯滿，封之於陳，以奉帝舜祀，是為胡公。
translations.literal: When Zhou's King Wu conquered Yin Zhou, he then again sought Shun's descendants, obtained Gui Man, and enfeoffed him at Chen to continue Emperor Shun's sacrifices. This was Duke Hu.
translations.idiomatic: When King Wu of Zhou conquered the Yin tyrant Zhou, he once again sought descendants of Shun, found Gui Man, and enfeoffed him at Chen to maintain the sacrifices to Emperor Shun. This man became known as Duke Hu.

context.previous: 夏后之時，或失或續。

translations.chinese: 胡公卒，子申公犀侯立。
translations.literal: Duke Hu died, and his son Duke Shen Xi Hou ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hu passed away, and his son Duke Shen Xi Hou succeeded him.

context.next: 申公卒，弟相公皋羊立。

translations.chinese: 申公卒，弟相公皋羊立。
translations.literal: Duke Shen died, and his younger brother Duke Xiang Gao Yang ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Shen died, and his younger brother Duke Xiang Gao Yang succeeded him.

context.previous: 胡公卒，子申公犀侯立。
context.next: 相公卒，立申公子突，是為孝公。

translations.chinese: 相公卒，立申公子突，是為孝公。
translations.literal: Duke Xiang died, and they established Duke Shen's son Tu, who became Duke Xiao.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiang died, and Duke Shen's son Tu was established on the throne, becoming Duke Xiao.

context.previous: 申公卒，弟相公皋羊立。
context.next: 孝公卒，子慎公圉戎立。

translations.chinese: 孝公卒，子慎公圉戎立。
translations.literal: Duke Xiao died, and his son Duke Shen Yu Rong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiao died, and his son Duke Shen Yu Rong succeeded him.

context.previous: 相公卒，立申公子突，是為孝公。
context.next: 慎公當周厲王時。

translations.chinese: 慎公當周厲王時。
translations.literal: Duke Shen was during King Li of Zhou's time.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Shen's reign coincided with the time of King Li of Zhou.

context.previous: 孝公卒，子慎公圉戎立。
context.next: 慎公卒，子幽公寧立。

translations.chinese: 慎公卒，子幽公寧立。
translations.literal: Duke Shen died, and his son Duke You Ning ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Shen died, and his son Duke You Ning succeeded him.

context.previous: 慎公當周厲王時。

translations.chinese: 幽公十二年，周厲王奔于彘。
translations.literal: In Duke You's twelfth year, King Li of Zhou fled to Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke You's twelfth year, King Li of Zhou fled to the town of Zhi.

translations.chinese: 二十三年，幽公卒，子釐公孝立。
translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Duke You died, and his son Duke Xi Xiao ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Duke You died, and his son Duke Xi Xiao succeeded him.

context.next: 釐公六年，周宣王即位。

translations.chinese: 釐公六年，周宣王即位。
translations.literal: In Duke Xi's sixth year, King Xuan of Zhou ascended the throne.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xi's sixth year, King Xuan of Zhou took the throne.

context.previous: 二十三年，幽公卒，子釐公孝立。
context.next: 三十六年，釐公卒，子武公靈立。

translations.chinese: 三十六年，釐公卒，子武公靈立。
translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Duke Xi died, and his son Duke Wu Ling ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, Duke Xi died, and his son Duke Wu Ling succeeded him.

context.previous: 釐公六年，周宣王即位。
context.next: 武公十五年卒，子夷公說立。

translations.chinese: 武公十五年卒，子夷公說立。
translations.literal: Duke Wu died in his fifteenth year, and his son Duke Yi Yue ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wu died in his fifteenth year, and his son Duke Yi Yue succeeded him.

context.previous: 三十六年，釐公卒，子武公靈立。
context.next: 是歲，周幽王即位。

translations.chinese: 是歲，周幽王即位。
translations.literal: In this year, King You of Zhou ascended the throne.
translations.idiomatic: That same year, King You of Zhou ascended the throne.

context.previous: 武公十五年卒，子夷公說立。
context.next: 夷公三年卒，弟平公燮立。

translations.chinese: 夷公三年卒，弟平公燮立。
translations.literal: Duke Yi died in his third year, and his younger brother Duke Ping Xie ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Yi died in his third year; his younger brother Duke Ping Xie succeeded him.

context.previous: 是歲，周幽王即位。
context.next: 平公七年，周幽王為犬戎所殺，周東徙。

translations.chinese: 平公七年，周幽王為犬戎所殺，周東徙。
translations.literal: In Duke Ping's seventh year, King You of Zhou was killed by the Quan Rong, and Zhou moved east.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ping's seventh year, King You of Zhou was killed by the Quan Rong tribes, and the Zhou court moved eastward.

context.previous: 夷公三年卒，弟平公燮立。
context.next: 秦始列為諸侯。

translations.chinese: 秦始列為諸侯。
translations.literal: Qin began to be ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Qin began to be recognized as one of the feudal lords.

context.previous: 平公七年，周幽王為犬戎所殺，周東徙。

translations.chinese: 二十三年，平公卒，子文公圉立。
translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Duke Ping died, and his son Duke Wen Yu ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Duke Ping died, and his son Duke Wen Yu succeeded him.

translations.chinese: 文公元年，取蔡女，生子佗。
translations.literal: In Duke Wen's first year, he took a Cai woman and gave birth to a son named Tuo.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Wen's first year, he married a woman from Cai and she bore him a son named Tuo.

context.next: 十年，文公卒，長子桓公鮑立。

translations.chinese: 十年，文公卒，長子桓公鮑立。
translations.literal: In the tenth year, Duke Wen died, and his eldest son Duke Huan Bao ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Duke Wen died, and his eldest son Duke Huan Bao succeeded him.

context.previous: 文公元年，取蔡女，生子佗。

translations.chinese: 桓公二十三年，魯隱公初立。
translations.literal: In Duke Huan's twenty-third year, Duke Yin of Lu first ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Huan's twenty-third year, Duke Yin of Lu first ascended the throne.

context.next: 二十六年，衛殺其君州吁。

translations.chinese: 二十六年，衛殺其君州吁。
translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, Wei assassinated their lord Zhou Xu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, the state of Wei assassinated their ruler Zhou Xu.

context.previous: 桓公二十三年，魯隱公初立。
context.next: 三十三年，魯弒其君隱公。

translations.chinese: 三十三年，魯弒其君隱公。
translations.literal: In the thirty-third year, Lu assassinated their lord Duke Yin.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, the state of Lu assassinated their ruler Duke Yin.

context.previous: 二十六年，衛殺其君州吁。

translations.chinese: 三十八年正月甲戌己丑，桓公鮑卒。
translations.literal: In the thirty-eighth year, first month, Jia Xu Ji Chou, Duke Huan Bao died.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-eighth year, on the day Jia Xu Ji Chou in the first month, Duke Huan Bao died.

context.next: 桓公弟佗，其母蔡女，故蔡人為佗殺五父及桓公太子免而立佗，是為厲公。

translations.chinese: 桓公弟佗，其母蔡女，故蔡人為佗殺五父及桓公太子免而立佗，是為厲公。
translations.literal: Duke Huan's younger brother Tuo—his mother was a Cai woman, so the Cai people killed Wu Fu and Duke Huan's crown prince Mian on Tuo's behalf and established Tuo, who became Duke Li.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan's younger brother Tuo had a Cai woman as his mother. Therefore, the people of Cai killed Wu Fu and Duke Huan's crown prince Mian on Tuo's behalf and installed Tuo as ruler. He became Duke Li.

context.previous: 三十八年正月甲戌己丑，桓公鮑卒。
context.next: 桓公病而亂作，國人分散，故再赴。

translations.chinese: 桓公病而亂作，國人分散，故再赴。
translations.literal: Duke Huan was ill and chaos arose. The state people dispersed, so there was a double announcement.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan fell ill and chaos broke out. The people of the state scattered, so the death announcement had to be sent twice.

context.previous: 桓公弟佗，其母蔡女，故蔡人為佗殺五父及桓公太子免而立佗，是為厲公。

translations.chinese: 厲公二年，生子敬仲完。
translations.literal: In Duke Li's second year, he gave birth to a son named Jing Zhong Wan.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Li's second year, a son was born to him named Jing Zhong Wan.

context.next: 周太史過陳，陳厲公使以《周易》筮之，卦得觀之否：「是為觀國之光，利用賓于王。

translations.chinese: 周太史過陳，陳厲公使以《周易》筮之，卦得觀之否：「是為觀國之光，利用賓于王。
translations.literal: Zhou Grand Scribe passed Chen, Chen Li Gong made with Zhou Yi divine it, hexagram obtained Guan of Pi: 'This is observe state light, beneficial guest at wang.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou Grand Scribe passed through Chen. Duke Li of Chen had him divine with the Zhou Yi, and the hexagram obtained Guan over Pi: 'This is to observe the state's light, beneficial to be a guest of the wang.

context.previous: 厲公二年，生子敬仲完。
context.next: 此其代陳有國乎？

translations.chinese: 此其代陳有國乎？
translations.literal: This will replace Chen have state?
translations.idiomatic: Will this replace Chen and have a state?

context.previous: 周太史過陳，陳厲公使以《周易》筮之，卦得觀之否：「是為觀國之光，利用賓于王。
context.next: 不在此，其在異國？

translations.chinese: 不在此，其在異國？
translations.literal: Not here, perhaps in different country?
translations.idiomatic: Not here, perhaps in a different country?

context.previous: 此其代陳有國乎？
context.next: 非此其身，在其子孫。

translations.chinese: 非此其身，在其子孫。
translations.literal: Not this person himself, but in his descendants.
translations.idiomatic: Not in this man's own lifetime, but in his descendants.

context.previous: 不在此，其在異國？
context.next: 若在異國，必姜姓。

translations.chinese: 若在異國，必姜姓。
translations.literal: If in a different country, it must be the Jiang surname.
translations.idiomatic: If it appears in another country, it must be among those with the Jiang surname.

context.previous: 非此其身，在其子孫。
context.next: 姜姓，太嶽之後。

translations.chinese: 姜姓，太嶽之後。
translations.literal: The Jiang surname are descendants of Tai Yue.
translations.idiomatic: Those with the Jiang surname are descendants of Tai Yue.

context.previous: 若在異國，必姜姓。
context.next: 物莫能兩大，陳衰，此其昌乎？」

translations.chinese: 物莫能兩大，陳衰，此其昌乎？」
translations.literal: Things cannot two great, Chen declines, this will prosper?'
translations.idiomatic: Things cannot have two that are great. Chen declines, so this will prosper?'

context.previous: 姜姓，太嶽之後。

translations.chinese: 厲公取蔡女，蔡女與蔡人亂，厲公數如蔡淫。
translations.literal: Duke Li took a Cai woman, but the Cai woman had illicit relations with Cai people. Duke Li frequently went to Cai to be licentious.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Li married a woman from Cai, but this Cai woman engaged in illicit relations with men from Cai. Duke Li frequently went to Cai for licentious purposes.

context.next: 七年，厲公所殺桓公太子免之三弟，長曰躍，中曰林，少曰杵臼，共令蔡人誘厲公以好女，與蔡人共殺厲公而立躍，是為利公。

translations.chinese: 七年，厲公所殺桓公太子免之三弟，長曰躍，中曰林，少曰杵臼，共令蔡人誘厲公以好女，與蔡人共殺厲公而立躍，是為利公。
translations.literal: In the seventh year, the three younger brothers of the Huan Gong crown prince Mian whom Li Gong had killed—the eldest named Yue, the middle named Lin, the youngest named Chu Jiu—together commanded the Cai people to lure Duke Li with beautiful women, and together with the Cai people killed Duke Li and established Yue, who became Duke Li.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, the three younger brothers of Duke Huan's crown prince Mian, whom Duke Li had killed—the eldest named Yue, the middle named Lin, the youngest named Chu Jiu—together instructed the Cai people to lure Duke Li with beautiful women. They joined with the Cai people to kill Duke Li and install Yue as ruler. He became Duke Li.

context.previous: 厲公取蔡女，蔡女與蔡人亂，厲公數如蔡淫。
context.next: 利公者，桓公子也。

translations.chinese: 利公者，桓公子也。
translations.literal: Duke Li was Duke Huan's son.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Li was a son of Duke Huan.

context.previous: 七年，厲公所殺桓公太子免之三弟，長曰躍，中曰林，少曰杵臼，共令蔡人誘厲公以好女，與蔡人共殺厲公而立躍，是為利公。
context.next: 利公立五月卒，立中弟林，是為莊公。

translations.chinese: 利公立五月卒，立中弟林，是為莊公。
translations.literal: Duke Li ascended for five months and died. They established his middle younger brother Lin, who became Duke Zhuang.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Li reigned for five months and died. They installed his middle younger brother Lin, who became Duke Zhuang.

context.previous: 利公者，桓公子也。
context.next: 莊公七年卒，少弟杵臼立，是為宣公。

translations.chinese: 莊公七年卒，少弟杵臼立，是為宣公。
translations.literal: Duke Zhuang died in his seventh year. His youngest younger brother Chu Jiu ascended, who became Duke Xuan.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang died in his seventh year. His youngest younger brother Chu Jiu ascended the throne and became Duke Xuan.

context.previous: 利公立五月卒，立中弟林，是為莊公。

translations.chinese: 宣公三年，楚武王卒，楚始彊。
translations.literal: In Duke Xuan's third year, King Wu of Chu died, and Chu began to grow strong.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xuan's third year, King Wu of Chu died, and Chu began to grow powerful.

context.next: 十七年，周惠王娶陳女為后。

translations.chinese: 十七年，周惠王娶陳女為后。
translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, King Hui of Zhou married a Chen woman as his queen.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, King Hui of Zhou married a woman from Chen as his queen.

context.previous: 宣公三年，楚武王卒，楚始彊。

translations.chinese: 二十一年，宣公後有嬖姬生子款，欲立之，乃殺其太子御寇。
translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Duke Xuan's queen had a favored concubine who gave birth to a son named Kuan. He desired to establish him, so he killed his crown prince Yu Kou.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, Duke Xuan had a favored concubine who bore him a son named Kuan. Desiring to make him heir, Duke Xuan killed his crown prince Yu Kou.

context.next: 御寇素愛厲公子完，完懼禍及己，乃奔齊。

translations.chinese: 御寇素愛厲公子完，完懼禍及己，乃奔齊。
translations.literal: Yu Kou usually loved Duke Li's son Wan. Wan feared calamity would reach himself, so he fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Yu Kou had long cherished Duke Li's son Wan. Wan feared that disaster would befall him too, so he fled to the state of Qi.

context.previous: 二十一年，宣公後有嬖姬生子款，欲立之，乃殺其太子御寇。
context.next: 齊桓公欲使陳完為卿，完曰：「羈旅之臣，幸得免負檐，君之惠也，不敢當高位。」

translations.chinese: 齊桓公欲使陳完為卿，完曰：「羈旅之臣，幸得免負檐，君之惠也，不敢當高位。」
translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong desired make Chen Wan minister, Wan said: 'Sojourning minister, fortunately obtained avoid carrying eaves, lord's favor, dare not accept high position.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi desired to make Chen Wan a minister. Wan said: 'A sojourning minister, I have fortunately obtained to avoid carrying eaves. It is your lordship's favor. I dare not accept a high position.'

context.previous: 御寇素愛厲公子完，完懼禍及己，乃奔齊。
context.next: 桓公使為工正。

translations.chinese: 桓公使為工正。
translations.literal: Duke Huan made him Gong Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan appointed him as the Director of Works.

context.previous: 齊桓公欲使陳完為卿，完曰：「羈旅之臣，幸得免負檐，君之惠也，不敢當高位。」
context.next: 齊懿仲欲妻陳敬仲，卜之，占曰：「是謂鳳皇于飛，和鳴鏘鏘。

translations.chinese: 齊懿仲欲妻陳敬仲，卜之，占曰：「是謂鳳皇于飛，和鳴鏘鏘。
translations.literal: Qi Yi Zhong desired marry Chen Jing Zhong, divined it, omen said: 'This called phoenix in flight, harmonious cry clang clang.
translations.idiomatic: Qi Yi Zhong desired to marry Chen Jing Zhong. He divined it, and the omen said: 'This is called phoenix in flight, harmonious cry clang clang.

context.previous: 桓公使為工正。
context.next: 有媯之後，將育于姜。

translations.chinese: 有媯之後，將育于姜。
translations.literal: Have Gui descendants, will be nourished at Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: There will be descendants of the Gui clan, who will be nurtured among the Jiang.

context.previous: 齊懿仲欲妻陳敬仲，卜之，占曰：「是謂鳳皇于飛，和鳴鏘鏘。
context.next: 五世其昌，并于正卿。

translations.chinese: 五世其昌，并于正卿。
translations.literal: Five generations will prosper, equal to the proper ministers.
translations.idiomatic: For five generations they will flourish and stand equal to the chief ministers.

context.previous: 有媯之後，將育于姜。
context.next: 八世之後，莫之與京。」

translations.chinese: 八世之後，莫之與京。」
translations.literal: Eight generations after, none rival with Jing.'
translations.idiomatic: Eight generations later, none will rival with Jing.'

context.previous: 五世其昌，并于正卿。

translations.chinese: 三十七年，齊桓公伐蔡，蔡敗；
translations.literal: Thirty-seventh year, Qi Huan Gong attacked Cai, Cai defeated;
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-seventh year, Duke Huan of Qi attacked Cai, and Cai was defeated;

context.next: 南侵楚，至召陵，還過陳。

translations.chinese: 南侵楚，至召陵，還過陳。
translations.literal: He invaded south to Chu, reached Zhao Ling, and on his return passed through Chen.
translations.idiomatic: He invaded southern Chu, reached Zhao Ling, and returned via Chen.

context.previous: 三十七年，齊桓公伐蔡，蔡敗；
context.next: 陳大夫轅濤涂惡其過陳，詐齊令出東道。

translations.chinese: 陳大夫轅濤涂惡其過陳，詐齊令出東道。
translations.literal: Chen's grand officer Yuan Tao Tu disliked his passing through Chen and deceived Qi by commanding him to take the east road.
translations.idiomatic: The Chen grand officer Yuan Tao Tu disliked the army passing through Chen and deceived Qi by ordering them to take the eastern route.

context.previous: 南侵楚，至召陵，還過陳。
context.next: 東道惡，桓公怒，執陳轅濤涂。

translations.chinese: 東道惡，桓公怒，執陳轅濤涂。
translations.literal: The east road was bad. Duke Huan was angered and seized Chen's Yuan Tao Tu.
translations.idiomatic: The eastern route was poor. Duke Huan became angry and seized the Chen official Yuan Tao Tu.

context.previous: 陳大夫轅濤涂惡其過陳，詐齊令出東道。
context.next: 是歲，晉獻公殺其太子申生。

translations.chinese: 是歲，晉獻公殺其太子申生。
translations.literal: In this year, Duke Xian of Jin killed his crown prince Shen Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: That same year, Duke Xian of Jin killed his crown prince Shen Sheng.

context.previous: 東道惡，桓公怒，執陳轅濤涂。

translations.chinese: 四十五年，宣公卒，子款立，是為穆公。
translations.literal: In the forty-fifth year, Duke Xuan died, and his son Kuan ascended, who became Duke Mu.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-fifth year, Duke Xuan died, and his son Kuan ascended the throne, becoming Duke Mu.

translations.literal: In Duke Huai's first year, Wu broke Chu and was at Ying, summoning the Chen hou.

translations.chinese: 陳侯欲往，大夫曰：「吳新得意；
translations.literal: Chen Hou desired go, grand officers said: 'Wu newly obtained delight;
translations.idiomatic: The Chen hou desired to go. The grand officers said: 'Wu has newly obtained delight;

context.previous: 懷公元年，吳破楚，在郢，召陳侯。
context.next: 楚王雖亡，與陳有故，不可倍。」

translations.chinese: 楚王雖亡，與陳有故，不可倍。」
translations.literal: Chu wang though perished, with Chen has old relations, cannot double-cross.'
translations.idiomatic: Though the Chu wang has perished, Chen has old relations with Chu, cannot double-cross.'

context.previous: 陳侯欲往，大夫曰：「吳新得意；
context.next: 懷公乃以疾謝吳。

translations.chinese: 懷公乃以疾謝吳。
translations.literal: Duke Huai then declined Wu with illness.

context.previous: 楚王雖亡，與陳有故，不可倍。」
context.next: 四年，吳復召懷公。

translations.chinese: 四年，吳復召懷公。
translations.literal: In the fourth year, Wu again summoned Duke Huai.

context.previous: 懷公乃以疾謝吳。
context.next: 懷公恐，如吳。

translations.chinese: 懷公恐，如吳。
translations.literal: Duke Huai feared and went to Wu.

context.previous: 四年，吳復召懷公。
context.next: 吳怒其前不往，留之，因卒吳。

translations.chinese: 吳怒其前不往，留之，因卒吳。
translations.literal: Wu was angered by his previous not going and detained him. He therefore died in Wu.

context.previous: 懷公恐，如吳。
context.next: 陳乃立懷公之子越，是為湣公。

translations.chinese: 陳乃立懷公之子越，是為湣公。
translations.literal: Chen then established Huai Gong's son Yue, this was Min Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Chen then established Duke Huai's son Yue, who became Duke Min.

context.previous: 吳怒其前不往，留之，因卒吳。

translations.chinese: 湣公六年，孔子適陳。
translations.literal: In Duke Min's sixth year, Kong Qiu went to Chen.

context.next: 吳王夫差伐陳，取三邑而去。

translations.chinese: 吳王夫差伐陳，取三邑而去。
translations.literal: King Fu Cha of Wu attacked Chen, took three cities, and left.

context.previous: 湣公六年，孔子適陳。
context.next: 十三年，吳復來伐陳，陳告急楚，楚昭王來救，軍於城父，吳師去。

translations.chinese: 十三年，吳復來伐陳，陳告急楚，楚昭王來救，軍於城父，吳師去。
translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Wu again came to attack Chen. Chen reported urgently to Chu. King Zhao of Chu came to save them and stationed at Cheng Fu. The Wu troops left.

context.previous: 吳王夫差伐陳，取三邑而去。
context.next: 是年，楚昭王卒於城父。

translations.chinese: 是年，楚昭王卒於城父。
translations.literal: In this year, King Zhao of Chu died at Cheng Fu.

context.previous: 十三年，吳復來伐陳，陳告急楚，楚昭王來救，軍於城父，吳師去。
context.next: 時孔子在陳。

translations.chinese: 時孔子在陳。
translations.literal: At that time, Kong Qiu was in Chen.

context.previous: 是年，楚昭王卒於城父。
context.next: 十五年，宋滅曹。

translations.chinese: 十五年，宋滅曹。
translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, Song extinguished Cao.

context.previous: 時孔子在陳。
context.next: 十六年，吳王夫差伐齊，敗之艾陵，使人召陳侯。

translations.chinese: 十六年，吳王夫差伐齊，敗之艾陵，使人召陳侯。
translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, King Fu Cha of Wu attacked Qi, defeated them at Ai Ling, and had people summon the Chen hou.

context.previous: 十五年，宋滅曹。
context.next: 陳侯恐，如吳。

translations.chinese: 陳侯恐，如吳。
translations.literal: The Chen hou feared and went to Wu.

context.previous: 十六年，吳王夫差伐齊，敗之艾陵，使人召陳侯。
context.next: 楚伐陳。

translations.chinese: 楚伐陳。
translations.literal: Chu attacked Chen.

context.previous: 陳侯恐，如吳。
context.next: 二十一年，齊田常弒其君簡公。

translations.chinese: 二十一年，齊田常弒其君簡公。
translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Qi's Tian Chang assassinated their lord Duke Jian.

context.previous: 楚伐陳。
context.next: 二十三年，楚之白公勝殺令尹子西、子綦，襲惠王。

translations.chinese: 二十三年，楚之白公勝殺令尹子西、子綦，襲惠王。
translations.literal: Twenty-third year, Chu's Bai Gong Sheng killed Ling Yin Zi Xi, Zi Qi, attacked Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Chu's Bai Gong Sheng killed Ling Yin Zi Xi and Zi Qi, and attacked King Hui.

context.previous: 二十一年，齊田常弒其君簡公。
context.next: 葉公攻敗白公，白公自殺。

translations.chinese: 葉公攻敗白公，白公自殺。
translations.literal: Duke Ye attacked and defeated Bai Gong. Bai Gong committed suicide.

context.previous: 二十三年，楚之白公勝殺令尹子西、子綦，襲惠王。

translations.chinese: 二十四年，楚惠王復國，以兵北伐，殺陳湣公，遂滅陳而有之。
translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, King Hui of Chu recovered his state and with troops attacked north, killed Duke Min of Chen, then extinguished Chen and possessed it.

context.next: 是歲，孔子卒。

translations.chinese: 是歲，孔子卒。
translations.literal: In this year, Kong Qiu died.

context.previous: 二十四年，楚惠王復國，以兵北伐，殺陳湣公，遂滅陳而有之。

translations.chinese: 杞東樓公者，夏后禹之後苗裔也。
translations.literal: Qi Dong Lou Gong was Xia Hou Yu's descendants posterity.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dong Lou of Qi was a descendant and posterity of Xia Hou Yu.

context.next: 殷時或封或絕。

translations.chinese: 殷時或封或絕。
translations.literal: During Yin times, they were sometimes enfeoffed and sometimes ended.

context.previous: 杞東樓公者，夏后禹之後苗裔也。
context.next: 周武王克殷紂，求禹之後，得東樓公，封之於杞，以奉夏后氏祀。

translations.chinese: 周武王克殷紂，求禹之後，得東樓公，封之於杞，以奉夏后氏祀。
translations.literal: Zhou's King Wu conquered Yin Zhou and sought Yu's descendants. He obtained Duke Dong Lou and enfeoffed him at Qi to continue the Xia Hou clan's sacrifices.

context.previous: 殷時或封或絕。

translations.chinese: 東樓公生西樓公，西樓公生題公，題公生謀娶公。
translations.literal: Duke Dong Lou gave birth to Duke Xi Lou. Duke Xi Lou gave birth to Duke Ti. Duke Ti gave birth to Duke Mou Qu.

context.next: 謀娶公當周厲王時。

translations.chinese: 謀娶公當周厲王時。
translations.literal: Duke Mou Qu was during King Li of Zhou's time.

context.previous: 東樓公生西樓公，西樓公生題公，題公生謀娶公。
context.next: 謀娶公生武公。

translations.chinese: 謀娶公生武公。
translations.literal: Duke Mou Qu gave birth to Duke Wu.

context.previous: 謀娶公當周厲王時。
context.next: 武公立四十七年卒，子靖公立。

translations.chinese: 武公立四十七年卒，子靖公立。
translations.literal: Duke Wu ascended for forty-seven years and died. His son Duke Jing ascended.

context.previous: 謀娶公生武公。
context.next: 靖公二十三年卒，子共公立。

translations.chinese: 靖公二十三年卒，子共公立。
translations.literal: Duke Jing died in his twenty-third year. His son Duke Gong ascended.

context.previous: 武公立四十七年卒，子靖公立。
context.next: 共公八年卒，子德公立。

translations.chinese: 共公八年卒，子德公立。
translations.literal: Duke Gong died in his eighth year. His son Duke De ascended.

context.previous: 靖公二十三年卒，子共公立。
context.next: 德公十八年卒，弟桓公姑容立。

translations.chinese: 德公十八年卒，弟桓公姑容立。
translations.literal: Duke De died in his eighteenth year. His younger brother Duke Huan Gu Rong ascended.

context.previous: 共公八年卒，子德公立。
context.next: 桓公十七年卒，子孝公丐立。

translations.chinese: 桓公十七年卒，子孝公丐立。
translations.literal: Duke Huan died in his seventeenth year. His son Duke Xiao Gai ascended.

context.previous: 德公十八年卒，弟桓公姑容立。
context.next: 孝公十七年卒，弟文公益姑立。

translations.chinese: 孝公十七年卒，弟文公益姑立。
translations.literal: Duke Xiao died in his seventeenth year. His younger brother Duke Wen Yi Gu ascended.

context.previous: 桓公十七年卒，子孝公丐立。
context.next: 文公十四年卒，弟平公郁立。

translations.chinese: 文公十四年卒，弟平公郁立。
translations.literal: Duke Wen died in his fourteenth year. His younger brother Duke Ping Yu ascended.

context.previous: 孝公十七年卒，弟文公益姑立。
context.next: 平公十八年卒，子悼公成立。

translations.chinese: 平公十八年卒，子悼公成立。
translations.literal: Duke Ping died in his eighteenth year. His son Duke Dao Cheng Li ascended.

context.previous: 文公十四年卒，弟平公郁立。
context.next: 悼公十二年卒，子隱公乞立。

translations.chinese: 悼公十二年卒，子隱公乞立。
translations.literal: Duke Dao died in his twelfth year. His son Duke Yin Qi ascended.

context.previous: 平公十八年卒，子悼公成立。
context.next: 七月，隱公弟遂弒隱公自立，是為釐公。

translations.chinese: 七月，隱公弟遂弒隱公自立，是為釐公。
translations.literal: In the seventh month, Duke Yin's younger brother Sui assassinated Duke Yin and self-established, becoming Duke Xi.

context.previous: 悼公十二年卒，子隱公乞立。
context.next: 釐公十九年卒，子湣公維立。

translations.chinese: 釐公十九年卒，子湣公維立。
translations.literal: Duke Xi died in his nineteenth year. His son Duke Min Wei ascended.

context.previous: 七月，隱公弟遂弒隱公自立，是為釐公。
context.next: 湣公十五年，楚惠王滅陳。

translations.chinese: 湣公十五年，楚惠王滅陳。
translations.literal: In Duke Min's fifteenth year, King Hui of Chu extinguished Chen.

context.previous: 釐公十九年卒，子湣公維立。
context.next: 十六年，湣公弟閼路弒湣公代立，是為哀公。

translations.chinese: 十六年，湣公弟閼路弒湣公代立，是為哀公。
translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Duke Min's younger brother Yan Lu assassinated Duke Min and replaced him, becoming Duke Ai.

context.previous: 湣公十五年，楚惠王滅陳。
context.next: 哀公立十年卒，湣公子敕立，是為出公。

translations.chinese: 哀公立十年卒，湣公子敕立，是為出公。
translations.literal: Duke Ai ascended for ten years and died. Duke Min's son Chi was established, becoming Duke Chu.

context.previous: 十六年，湣公弟閼路弒湣公代立，是為哀公。
context.next: 出公十二年卒，子簡公春立。

translations.chinese: 出公十二年卒，子簡公春立。
translations.literal: Duke Chu died in his twelfth year. His son Duke Jian Chun ascended.

context.previous: 哀公立十年卒，湣公子敕立，是為出公。
context.next: 立一年，楚惠王之四十四年，滅杞。

translations.chinese: 立一年，楚惠王之四十四年，滅杞。
translations.literal: He ascended for one year. In King Hui of Chu's forty-fourth year, they extinguished Qi.

context.previous: 出公十二年卒，子簡公春立。
context.next: 杞後陳亡三十四年。

translations.chinese: 杞後陳亡三十四年。
translations.literal: Qi perished thirty-four years after Chen.

context.previous: 立一年，楚惠王之四十四年，滅杞。

translations.chinese: 杞小微，其事不足稱述。
translations.literal: Qi was small and tiny. Its affairs are insufficient to praise and narrate.

translations.chinese: 舜之後，周武王封之陳，至楚惠王滅之，有世家言。
translations.literal: Shun's descendants—Zhou's King Wu enfeoffed them at Chen, until King Hui of Chu extinguished them. There are hereditary houses that speak of this.

context.next: 禹之後，周武王封之杞，楚惠王滅之，有世家言。

translations.chinese: 禹之後，周武王封之杞，楚惠王滅之，有世家言。
translations.literal: Yu's descendants—Zhou's King Wu enfeoffed them at Qi, until King Hui of Chu extinguished them. There are hereditary houses that speak of this.

context.previous: 舜之後，周武王封之陳，至楚惠王滅之，有世家言。
context.next: 契之後為殷，殷有本紀言。

translations.chinese: 契之後為殷，殷有本紀言。
translations.literal: Qi's descendants became Yin. Yin has basic annals that speak of this.

context.previous: 禹之後，周武王封之杞，楚惠王滅之，有世家言。
context.next: 殷破，周封其後於宋，齊湣王滅之，有世家言。

translations.chinese: 殷破，周封其後於宋，齊湣王滅之，有世家言。
translations.literal: Yin was broken. Zhou enfeoffed their descendants at Song. Duke Min of Qi extinguished them. There are hereditary houses that speak of this.

context.previous: 契之後為殷，殷有本紀言。
context.next: 后稷之後為周，秦昭王滅之，有本紀言。

translations.chinese: 后稷之後為周，秦昭王滅之，有本紀言。
translations.literal: Hou Ji's descendants became Zhou. King Zhao of Qin extinguished them. There are basic annals that speak of this.

context.previous: 殷破，周封其後於宋，齊湣王滅之，有世家言。
context.next: 皋陶之後，或封英、六，楚穆王滅之，無譜。

translations.chinese: 皋陶之後，或封英、六，楚穆王滅之，無譜。
translations.literal: Gao Yao's descendants were sometimes enfeoffed at Ying and Liu. King Mu of Chu extinguished them. There is no genealogy.

context.previous: 后稷之後為周，秦昭王滅之，有本紀言。
context.next: 伯夷之後，至周武王復封於齊，曰太公望，陳氏滅之，有世家言。

translations.chinese: 伯夷之後，至周武王復封於齊，曰太公望，陳氏滅之，有世家言。
translations.literal: Bo Yi's descendants were again enfeoffed at Qi by Zhou's King Wu, called Tai Gong Wang. The Chen clan extinguished them. There are hereditary houses that speak of this.

context.previous: 皋陶之後，或封英、六，楚穆王滅之，無譜。
context.next: 伯翳之後，至周平王時封為秦，項羽滅之，有本紀言。

translations.chinese: 伯翳之後，至周平王時封為秦，項羽滅之，有本紀言。
translations.literal: Bo Yi's descendants were enfeoffed as Qin during King Ping of Zhou's time. Xiang Yu extinguished them. There are basic annals that speak of this.

context.previous: 伯夷之後，至周武王復封於齊，曰太公望，陳氏滅之，有世家言。
context.next: 垂、益、夔、龍，其後不知所封，不見也。

translations.chinese: 垂、益、夔、龍，其後不知所封，不見也。
translations.literal: Chui, Yi, Kui, and Long—their descendants are not known where they were enfeoffed and are not seen.

context.previous: 伯翳之後，至周平王時封為秦，項羽滅之，有本紀言。
context.next: 右十一人者，皆唐虞之際名有功德臣也；

translations.chinese: 右十一人者，皆唐虞之際名有功德臣也；
translations.literal: Right eleven people, all Tang Yu time famous meritorious virtue ministers;
translations.idiomatic: These eleven people on the right were all famous ministers with meritorious virtue during Tang and Yu's time;

context.previous: 垂、益、夔、龍，其後不知所封，不見也。
context.next: 其五人之後皆至帝王，餘乃為顯諸侯。

translations.chinese: 其五人之後皆至帝王，餘乃為顯諸侯。
translations.literal: Their five people's descendants all became emperor kings, remainder became illustrious feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Their five people's descendants all became emperors and kings. The remainder became illustrious feudal lords.

context.previous: 右十一人者，皆唐虞之際名有功德臣也；
context.next: 滕、薛、騶，夏、殷、周之閒封也，小，不足齒列，弗論也。

translations.chinese: 滕、薛、騶，夏、殷、周之閒封也，小，不足齒列，弗論也。
translations.literal: Teng, Xue, and Zou were enfeoffed between Xia, Yin, and Zhou. They were small and insufficient to rank with the teeth. They are not discussed.

context.previous: 其五人之後皆至帝王，餘乃為顯諸侯。

translations.chinese: 周武王時，侯伯尚千餘人。
translations.literal: During Zhou's King Wu's time, there were still over a thousand hou and bo.

context.next: 及幽、厲之後，諸侯力攻相并。

translations.chinese: 及幽、厲之後，諸侯力攻相并。
translations.literal: And after You and Li, the feudal lords attacked each other with force and annexed one another.

context.previous: 周武王時，侯伯尚千餘人。
context.next: 江、黃、胡、沈之屬，不可勝數，故弗采著于傳（上）［云］。

translations.chinese: 江、黃、胡、沈之屬，不可勝數，故弗采著于傳（上）［云］。
translations.literal: Jiang, Huang, Hu, Shen and such, cannot exhaust count, therefore not collected recorded in transmissions (upper) [cloud].
translations.idiomatic: Jiang, Huang, Hu, Shen and such could not be exhaustively counted, so they were not collected and recorded in the transmissions [cloud].

context.previous: 及幽、厲之後，諸侯力攻相并。
context.next: 太史公曰：舜之德可謂至矣！

translations.chinese: 太史公曰：舜之德可謂至矣！
translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Shun virtue can be called utmost!
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: Shun's virtue can be called the utmost!

context.previous: 江、黃、胡、沈之屬，不可勝數，故弗采著于傳（上）［云］。
context.next: 禪位於夏，而後世血食者歷三代。

translations.chinese: 禪位於夏，而後世血食者歷三代。
translations.literal: He yielded the throne to Xia, and his later generations' blood sacrifices spanned three dynasties.

context.previous: 太史公曰：舜之德可謂至矣！
context.next: 及楚滅陳，而田常得政於齊，卒為建國，百世不絕，苗裔茲茲，有土者不乏焉。

translations.chinese: 及楚滅陳，而田常得政於齊，卒為建國，百世不絕，苗裔茲茲，有土者不乏焉。
translations.literal: And when Chu extinguished Chen, Tian Chang obtained government in Qi. He finally established a state that has not ended for a hundred generations. His descendants flourish and flourish. Those with land are not lacking.

context.previous: 禪位於夏，而後世血食者歷三代。
context.next: 至禹，於周則杞，微甚，不足數也。

translations.chinese: 至禹，於周則杞，微甚，不足數也。
translations.literal: As for Yu, in Zhou it was Qi. It was extremely tiny and insufficient to count.

context.previous: 及楚滅陳，而田常得政於齊，卒為建國，百世不絕，苗裔茲茲，有土者不乏焉。
context.next: 楚惠王滅杞，其後越王句踐興。

translations.chinese: 楚惠王滅杞，其後越王句踐興。
translations.literal: King Hui of Chu extinguished Qi. His descendants' King Gou Jian of Yue rose.

context.previous: 至禹，於周則杞，微甚，不足數也。
